definition: article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)

sentences.english: As to sacrifice, both he and Zeus delighted most in bulls.
sentences.chinese: 朱庇特和宙斯都最喜欢将公牛作为他们的供品。

sentences.english: According to the Thai Theravada tradition, the Kathina robes and other requisite offerings are sponsored by various individuals.
sentences.chinese: 根据泰国佛教传统僧袍与一切供品均由各方佛友赞助。

sentences.english: These early years, people begin preparations for the offerings.
sentences.chinese: 这时候开始，人们就开始准备供品了。

sentences.english: Festivalgoers leave offerings for the Hindu deity Lord Shiva.
sentences.chinese: 节日活动留下了给印度教湿婆神的供品。

sentences.english: This was a modern version of the sacrificial offerings buried in the imperial tombs.
sentences.chinese: 这是葬入皇帝墓中的牺牲供品的现代版。

sentences.english: They laid their gifts at the feet of the statue of the Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 他们将供品放在佛像脚下。

sentences.english: Records dating from this period include details of deliveries of cocoa which were imposed as tributes on conquered tribes.
sentences.chinese: 据史料记载，可可常作为上贡给获胜部落的供品。

sentences.english: After putting various offerings on the altar table , he kneeled down and began to offer sacrifices to the ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 他在供案上摆放了各种供品，然后开始跪拜祭祀。

sentences.english: Indonesian women take part in a procession to Nusa Dua temple in southern Bali, carrying offerings atop their heads.
sentences.chinese: 印尼妇女头顶供品参加前往南巴厘努沙杜瓦寺的游行。

sentences.english: Have you not got ready the offering basket for the evening servece?
sentences.chinese: 你还没有准备好晚祷的供品篮吗？

sentences.english: As for Shanghai, green groups are very ancestor-worship clear offerings.
sentences.chinese: 对上海人而言，青团是清明祭祖时必不可少的供品。

definition: the three sacrificial animals (originally cow, sheep and pig; later pig, chicken and fish)
to respect a deity/to pray to a God
to consecrate/to enshrine and worship/an offering (to one's ancestors)/a sacrifice (to a God)
Zaoshen, the god of the kitchen/also written 灶神
ritual money made of paper burnt for the Gods or the dead
